♡☭☆ Rules ☆☭♡

This ruleset is original





General Information

  • Do not quote PMs from the moderator into the gamethread, and do not quote anything from a PT into the gamethread. Paraphrasing is OK.
  • Do not discuss this game with anyone outside of the main gamethread and any relevant PTs.
  • Do not make text intentionally difficult to read (examples include invisible text, small text, and text hidden via BBCode) or any form of encryption. Exceptions include spoiler tags and breadcrumbs.
  • Even if you have the permissions to, do not edit or delete posts in the game thread. If you made a formatting mistake that impacts readability, notify me and I will attempt to fix it as soon as possible.

Activity

  • I deliver prods after 48 hours of inactivity unless a player is V/LA.
  • A prodded player has 24 hours to make a game-advancing post before I replace them.
  • Three prods leads to a force-replace.
  • If I accidentally prod you while on V/LA or before your 48 hours are up, the prod will not count against you.
  • If I am asked to prod a player when, by the rules, they do not need to be prodded, I may send them an "informal prod" if I feel the circumstances of the game permit it.
  • Please bold any requests to have a V/LA made in the gamethread. I will acknowledge an unbolded request, but having it bolded ensures I see it.
  • If a V/LA is longer than 4 days, you must post at least once every 72 hours. Depending on the nature of the V/LA, I may be less stringent on the amount of content needed for a post to count.

Gameplay

  • The game's day phases will last two weeks (14 days).
  • The game's night phases will last two days. The night may be extended if I cannot access the gamethread at the time of the daystart or ensure my back-up mod can.
  • You may use either vote or bold tags to indicate a vote, as long as it is formatted as VOTE: gigabyteTroubadour or VOTE: gigabyteTroubadour.
  • Any sort of misspelling, pun, nickname, or abbreviation will count in a vote, as long as it's clear who is being voted for. VOTE: Giggles would be a valid vote for myself if I were in the game.
  • As soon as a simple majority of players vote for the same player, the day ends with the death and role reveal of that player.
  • Players are free to post during the day until I lock the thread. Even a lynched player may continue to post until they are flipped.
  • Players who die, whether by lynch or by night kill, are allowed to post one "bah" post after their flip. After that, dead players are not allowed to post in the gamethread until the end of the game.
  • If a player is modkilled for any reason, the day will continue as normal unless the game ends with that player's death.
  • Any informed minority groups are guaranteed to have daytalk at all times.
  • Players with access to a factional kill (such as mafia members) are able to use their factional kill while using an ability granted by a role.
  • Always play to your win condition.

Moderation

  • I reserve the right to update the rules as I see fit midgame. If I make any changes to the ruleset, I will make a post in the main gamethread acknowledging the specific change as transparently as possible.
  • I reserve the right to enforce my rules as I see them and with the appropriate consequences.
  • If I anticipate being busy or if I drop off the face of the Earth, Ether is my back-up mod and will help with moderation stuffs!
  • Please avoid using #C3B4ED, #ABDAE9, #FFBDF4, and colors that look similar. Please also do not use the font "Helvetica". This font and these colors are reserved for modposts and should not be used to avoid confusion between my posts and players' posts. If you feel there is an exception that gives you the right to use these colors, please let me know before using them.

Ethics

  • Remember, the forum rules and guidelines apply everywhere on site, and my games are no exception.
  • Be mindful of the language you use when posting. I am fine with cursing, but I will censor players who use harmful slurs and force-replace them if it gets excessive.
  • If the gamethread is excessively toxic, I will do my best to resolve the issues as diplomatically as possible without harming the gamestate. This may include warnings for harassment, but if that is not enough I will not hesitate to force-replace players.
  • Have fun! Mafia gets heated sometimes but that should not interfere with your enjoyment of the game.
  • Do not hesitate to ask me any questions or send any concerns about the rules or the game via PM.


Set-up

  • It is guaranteed that there are 10 members of the town faction and 3 members of the mafia faction.
  • The setup was reviewed for normalcy and balance by Radiant "Raybells" Cowbells, Fire "Brain" bringer, and Penguin "Karnos V2 Electric Boogaloo: This Time He's a Decent Person" Power. Thanks for your hard work!
  • At least 1 player will have a VT role pm, which looks like this:
    Spoiler: Sample VT PM
    ♡☭☆ Mini Normal 1933 ☆☭♡
    ~ Role PM ~


    Welcome, gigabyteTroubadour! You are a Vanilla Townie, which means:

    • During the day, you may vote for any players you wish to lynch. As soon as a simple majority of players vote for the same player, the day ends with the death and role reveal of that player.
    • During the night, you have no special abilities that you may use.
    • You win the game with the other town members once all threats to the town have been eliminated.

    Please confirm you've received this PM by replying to me and by stating the name of your role. The game begins as soon as 12/13 players confirm their roles.

Role PMs are out!

aaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaand....

We just got 12 confirmations! Thread's gonna be unlocked now and day start PMs will roll out soon. Happy scumhunting!

ok

i was hoping to have more in-depth criticism but thinking about everyone's play individually, i'm going to be honest and say that no "one person" played bad. town was shitty as a collective. the first day was decided too quickly because people got frustrated from the length. uzi made a weird call and people thought mulch was town so he was able to powerlynch uzi without town thinking the situation through too closely. the rest of the lynches were decided very quickly - i recognize that I basically dropped off the face of the earth for a few days but I felt like one minute I look away and the next town's lynched someone and there's a warning from nexus on someone the next ! Not a good sign, imo. I think town would have made a lot better decisions if things were just thought out a bit more.

On the Uzi lynch, I don't really like... fault Fish for it - I understand where he was coming from from the last game at the time but it just wasn't the same kind of situation. If anything, what happened was the reverse of what happened there. When someone, regardless of your read of them, declares that they have information that almost completely incriminates someone, the mechanically correct play is always to lynch the guilty. Mulch's information was not like that. Uzi's was. When someone claims cop-with-a-guilty, you don't lynch the cop just because you scumread them earlier on. This is generally for two reasons: A, their PR could be used again, and B: scum have a lot less to gain from sacrificing themselves from a lynch that benefits their team. The pertinent question that should have been asked was "Why does scum Uzi do this?" If Mulch was worth sacrificing a mafia member over, scum more than likely could have just night killed him if he was town. All scum!Uzi gains from this is putting himself on a short timer for no reason. Mulch's claim, on the other hand, was made for no reason other than to get Game Replacement off his back and to scare people from lynching him. There were clear differences in how both of them went around their claims - with Uzi trying to get Mulch to spew associations while he didn't know that Uzi was a pr, vs Mulch being vague about his claim in a way transparency would have just helped town more.

Other than that I don't really have any strong opinions about this game tbh.

I think out the playerlist I want to give a shoutout to tictac the most - it was awesome seeing you come out of your comfort zone and seeing how thought out your scumplay was! I'm mostly saying this because I don't think I've mentioned this in the dead thread but i was expecting tictac to be lynched very early on with how he was talking about his play but I think he made the best of a situation and helped his team win.

tbh. I didn't like fish "do this or else" attitude about it, and I probs would not have gone along either. It's a playstyle thing tho, and not really scummy unless the person is otherwise reasonable.

Some people get a large benefit reads-wise from free exchange of ideas, but that is a select crowd, and I don't think either fish or you are members.
Neighborhood is also a good place to speculate about things it would be anti-town to talk about in the open. (like PR spec). It's pretty unlikely that ya giving away any info that scumteam doesn't already have, since they gonna be specifically looking for that stuff anyways.

Next time don't go along with people because ya think ya gonna get NK'd otherwise. Getting KN'd is a good thing as VT and that is basically what a neighbor is.

If ya gambiting in the main thread and yer target doesn't seem to be partners with yer target, say ya are gambiting in the neighborhood. Then yer neighbor can bail ya out if it goes wrong?

Alternatively ya might consider doing the Mastina thing and simply treating it like a masonry from the start.
The potential damage done if you are wrong can be much smaller than the potential benefit if ya happen to be right.
Ya need a partner who would be willing to go along with it tho.

Ya might get a kick out of reading this:
viewtopic.php?f=94&t=66050
I was scum JOAT with Piper with a neighborizer shot, and I neighborized them on the logic of "if we were scumpartners, that is simply an insane thing to do".
We used it for a townie-larping basically, but I think it's pretty much what I would try to do in an actual neighborhood.

(I simulated a version of the neighborhood gambit I talked about earlier. Plan was this: "neighborize night1; fakeclaim stronger JOAT without BP and use BP night2; claim guilty on neighbor if there is skipped kill". By happenstance I 'caught' my scumpartner with it, but obviously didn't claim the 'result' in main thread. )

Basically, neighborhood is a place where ya can say stuff ya know will get ya scumreads in the main thread, but that ya know your neighbor doesn't scumread.
Being familiar with the person ya are talking with is a HUGE benefit.

More specifically about yer clash with fish:

I think it was a mismatch of playstyles, and there was nothing really ya could have done to prevent it since "be a completely different person" isn't really a thing anyone can do.

If ya can foresee things going in similar direction there is nothing wrong with saying "I don't think this neighborhood is gonna be at all useful and I'm not gonna write anything in here". It is a pretty common attitude to neighborhoods in general.

I tried to find stats on how common t+t neighborhoods actually are versus t+s neighborhoods.
Couldn't find any on cursory search, but my intuition is that t+t is way more common.
That isn't supposed to be the case but it probably is.
